description:
Amateur radio logbook software.

QLog is an Amateur Radio logging application for Linux, Windows. It is based on the Qt framework and uses SQLite as database backend.
QLogs aims to be as simple as possible, but to provide everything the operator expects from the log to be. This log is not currently focused on contests.
github
- Fixed compilation issue under Debian 12 (issue #571)
- Fixed Incorrect GPL version in rpm/deb packages (issue #572)
- Fixed MacOS floating utility window bug (PR #576 @kyleboyle)
- Updated IT translation
Full Changelog: https://github.com/foldynl/QLog/compare/v0.41.0...v0.41.1
WINDOWS USER ONLY
If you have installed versions 0.35.2 or older, perform a manual uninstall and then install the new version of QLog. There is no need to worry about your QSOs during the uninstall, as the uninstall procedure does not delete the internal data of QLog. Of course, a backup is always recommended.
If you have installed versions 0.36 or newer, then it is not necessary to perform an uninstall.
Flatpak:
Qt 6.8.x
hamlib 4.6
Windows Libraries:
Qt 6.6.3
openssl 3.3.2 (Updated)
hamlib 4.6 (Updated)
Timezone DB: 2024b (https://github.com/evansiroky/timezone-boundary-builder/releases)
Binaries:
Windows: below
Fedora 40: below
Fedora 41: below
Ubuntu 20.04, 22.04, 24.04, 24.10: via PPA (https://launchpad.net/~foldyna/+archive/ubuntu/qlog)
Flatpak package is available via Flathub. The package contains built-in Trusted QSL.
MacOS DMG: https://github.com/aa5sh/QLog/releases (available later)
